name: Silent Sound - Middlesbrough (2010)
description: This strictly limited edition publication was produced to accompany Iain Forsyth & Jane Pollard's Silent Sound, presented as part of AV Festival 10 at Middlesbrough Town Hall on 7th March 2010. The package includes a live recording produced on the night featuring an introduction by Dr. Ciaran O'Keeffe and an original score by J. Spaceman (Spiritualized). Conducted by Matthew Wood. Limited to only 1000 copies, 250 of which were given to the audience attending the performance. The copies for sale are numbered and signed by Iain Forsyth & Jane Pollard and J. Spaceman. Designed by Chris Bigg (v23). More info: www.silentsound.info Please be aware that this live CD was professionally recorded and produced on the night and as such the discs are high-quality CD-Rs and not factory pressed 'silver' discs.

name: File under Sacred Music poster (2009)
description: 23" × 33" (A1) poster print on 170gsm art paper This poster print was produced to accompany the exhibition 'Desiring Necessities' at the John Hansard Gallery, Southampton in a limited edition of 1000 copies. The last few remaining copies are being made available here. The poster, designed by Iain Forsyth & Jane Pollard, relates to File under Sacred Music, one of their most significant video works to date. Taking as its starting point an infamous tape of The Cramps performing at Napa State Mental Institute, California in 1978 the artists set about remaking the video. Supported by Shooting Live Artists (a joint initiative of the BBC and Arts Council England), File under Sacred Music has been presented as a video installation at galleries and museums around the world. More info: www.fileundersacredmusic.com This poster print is not signed or numbered, and will be delivered rolled inside a cardboard poster tube.

name: The thin red line (2008)
description: Embroidered woolen scarf Edition of 25 Based on the traditional Oxbridge academic scarf, ‘The thin red line’ is for those who stand their ground, a sartorial symbol of defiance. The scarf embodies the form of a thin red line, and the embroidered motto refers to the origins of the title. The phrase ‘the thin red line’ derives from the Crimean War, when during the Battle of Balaclava on 25th October 1854 the heavily depleted British Army’s 93rd regiment faced a Russian cavalry charge with a line of men only two deep instead of the conventional four. The soldiers were led by Sir Colin Campbell, who is said to have told his men ’There is no retreat from here, men. You must die where you stand’. Forsyth and Pollard’s interest in coded communication and secret societies first emerged as part of their ‘Silent Sound’ project produced with J. Spaceman for A Foundation during the 2006 Liverpool Biennial. This limited edition is available exclusively from 176/Zabludowicz Collection. Please order directly. Order directly from: www.projectspace176.com/shop/editions

name: Judgement (You Better Get Ready) (2007)
description: 10" x 8" digital photographic print Unlimited edition This work was originally produced for "Harry Smith Anthology Remixed" a touring exhibition of artworks inspired by the legendary Harry Smith Anthology of American Folk Music. Iain Forsyth & Jane Pollard selected the track Judgement by Sister Mary Nelson. This is how they described the project: “Judgement is a haunting track that seems to truly embody the spirit of the Anthology. We wanted to step inside it, to understand it, and to echo its conspiratorial sense of endeavour and purpose. It's unquestionably a call to action - so we took to the streets, to Trafalgar Square, and set about spreading the word of the song. This is our cover version.” This is an unlimited edition supplied unframed and unmounted. The print is not signed or numbered by the artists.

name: Silent Sound - Liverpool (2006) SOLD OUT
description:
Iain Forsyth & Jane Pollard’s Silent Sound features an original score by J. Spaceman (Spiritualized) and an introduction by Dr. Ciaran O’Keeffe. Recorded live at St. George’s Hall, Liverpool on 14th September 2006.

This special package designed by Chris Bigg and Vaughan Oliver at V23 is strictly limited to 1000 numbered copies, each signed by Iain Forsyth & Jane Pollard and J. Spaceman.
